roberto_lucente wrote:

> OS: Windows NT 4.0 SP6a
> Java: 1.4.2_04-b05
> 
>  >From the dos prompt I run the following via a .bat
> 
> set classpath=H:\languages\java\JUnit\junit3.8.1
> \junit.jar;H:\languages\java\JUnit\junit3.8.1
> \junit.jar;H:\languages\java\JUnit\junit3.8.1
> \junit\tests\runner;H:\languages\java\JUnit\junit3.8.1\junit\samples;

Bad classpath!

Problem #1, you have junit.jar on there twice. Remove one.
Problem #2, you have ./junit/tests/runner and ./junit/samples on there, 
which won't work. Remove them, then add:

h:\languages\java\JUnit\junit3.8.1

If you are very new to Java, then please search the web for a tutorial 
on how to set the CLASSPATH for a Java application.

Good luck.
--
